alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:43PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. 1 to 2 feet of snow with up to 5 to 7 inches of liquid equivalent still remain in the higher elevations of Bayfield county that will continue to melt impacting rivers, creeks, and streams flowing into Lake Superior. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, Bayfield County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. County, township, and forest roads may flood, especially in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM CDT, emergency management and trained spotters reported snowmelt and flooding in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Raspberry River, Sioux River, Pikes Creek, Whittlesey Creek, Sand River, Siskiwit River, Cranberry River, Red Cliff Creek, Thompson Creek, Little Sioux River, Pine Creek, North Fish Creek, Little Pine Creek, Onion River, - Numerous city or township roads are still closed due to flooding including in Red Cliff, Washburn, Town of Russell, and Town of Bell. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washburn, Barksdale, Bayfield, Cornucopia, Sand Bay, Herbster, Red Cliff, the Tribal Lands of the Red Cliff Reservation. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads in hilly terrain. Find an alternate route. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
